text: <extra_id_0> Interleukin 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) is an important lymphokine required in the process of T cell activation , proliferation , clonal expansion and differentiation .

The <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene displays both T cell specific and inducible expression : it is only expressed in <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T cells after antigenic or mitogenic stimulation .

text: Several cis - acting regulatory sites are required for induction of the <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene after stimulation .
event: <extra_id_0> <extra_id_0> Positive_regulation required <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme induction <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Positive_regulation induction <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme IL-2 <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1>

text: In this study , we have analysed the function of these cis - acting regulatory sites in the context of the native <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> enhancer and promoter sequence .

The results of this study suggest that the NFAT ( -276 to -261 ) , the distal octamer ( -256 to -248 ) and the proximal octamer ( -75 to -66 ) sites not only act as enhancers of <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene transcription in the presence of cellular stimulation , but also have a silencing effect on <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression in resting cells .

text: Two other sites display disparate effects on <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression in different T leukemia cell lines : the distal purine box ( -291 to -277 ) and the proximal purine box sites ( -145 to -128 ) .
event: <extra_id_0> <extra_id_0> Regulation display disparate effects <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme expression <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Gene_expression expression <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme IL-2 <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1>

text: Finally , the AP-1 ( -186 to -176 ) and the kappa B sites ( -206 to -195 ) respond to different cellular activation in EL4 cells .
The AP-1 site mediated the response to PMA stimulation while the kappa B site responded to IL-1 stimulation .

These data suggest that the regulation of <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression is a complex process and multiple cis - acting regulatory sites interact to exert different effects in T cells representative of alternative stages of differentiation .
